[[Atlantic Records]] (US) | Writer = [[Tony Banks (musician)|Tony Banks]], [[Phil Collins]], [[Mike Rutherford]] | Producer = [[David Hentschel]] and Genesis | Last single = "[[Turn It on Again]]"
(1980) | This single = "'''Duchess'''"
(1980) | Next single = "[[Misunderstanding (Genesis song)|Misunderstanding]]"
(1980) | Misc = {{Extra track listing | Album = [[Duke (album)|Duke]] | Type = studio | prev_track = "[[Behind the Lines (Genesis song)|Behind the Lines]]" | prev_no = Track 1 | this_track = "Duchess" | track_no = Track 2 | next_track = "Guide Vocal" | next_no = Track 3 }} }} "'''Duchess'''" is a song by the [[Great Britain|British]] band [[Genesis (band)|Genesis]], appearing as the second track on their 1980's album, ''[[Duke (album)|Duke]]''. It peaked at number 46 in the [[UK Singles Chart]]. Part of the album's "hidden suite" which also included "[[Behind the Lines (Genesis song)|Behind the Lines]]", "Guide Vocal", "[[Turn It on Again]]", "Duke's Travels" and "Duke's End," the lyrics tell the story of a rise and fall of a diva from the beginning of her career, to her superstardom, to her decline in public opinion. It is the first Genesis song to use a [[Roland CR-78|drum machine]]. The band made a video for the song. It showed [[Phil Collins]], [[Tony Banks (musician)|Tony Banks]] and [[Mike Rutherford]] playing at various points around the Liverpool Empire theatre and watching the Duchess perform her songs, Collins nodding his head in approval. The drum machine used in the song ([[Roland CR-78]]) is shown at the beginning of the video. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Genesis}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Duchess (Song)}} [[Category:1980 singles]] [[Category:Genesis (band) songs]] [[Category:Songs written by Phil Collins]] [[Category:Songs written by Tony Banks]] [[Category:Songs written by Mike Rutherford]] [[es:Duchess]] [[ka:Duchess (á¡ááá¦áá á)]]
